Description: This session will discuss new knowledge on myeloid cell contribution to tumor specific immunity and how this new knowledge can be used to develop novel therapeutic targets for the treatment of cancer patients. We will have three lectures given by experts in the field discussing different strategies to identify myeloid pathways that impact therapeutic antitumor immunity. Dr. Brown will open the session and discuss a novel spatial functional genomic screen that he recently developed to identify tumor cues that control the spatial distribution and cellular interactions of immune cells in the TME with a focus on myeloid cells. Dr. Mellman will discuss recent studies, including novel screens that revealed myeloid cells and T cell interactions as key drivers of effective cancer immunity, while Dr. Merad will discuss recent results from clinical immunotherapy trials and mice studies that revealed how the same myeloid target can either significantly dampen or enhance tumor specific immunity depending on the  tumor context.
SearchResultBody: SY19. Myeloid Cell Control of Therapeutic Antitumor Immunity
Title: Myeloid Cell Control of Therapeutic Antitumor Immunity
